title: Tech - South China Morning Post
description: The latest technology news, reviews, gadgets, launches and products.

items.title: Hong Kong reaps the fruits of fintech seeds sown nearly 10 years ago
items.creator: Enoch Yiu
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Hong Kong reaps the fruits of fintech seeds sown nearly 10 years ago

images.alt: HSBC CEO Georges Elhedery (left) takes part in a discussion with Financial Secretary Paul Chan Mo-po (centre) and Standard Chartered CEO at the Hong Kong FinTech Week on November 3. Photo: Jonathan Wong
images.title: HSBC CEO Georges Elhedery (left) takes part in a discussion with Financial Secretary Paul Chan Mo-po (centre) and Standard Chartered CEO at the Hong Kong FinTech Week on November 3. Photo: Jonathan Wong

items.content:
When Alvin Kwock, co-founder of digital insurer OneDegree, took part in the inaugural Hong Kong FinTech Week in November 2016, it was held at a venue suitable for only a few hundred people.
“As it was the first ever fintech event in Hong Kong, only fintech start-ups were interested, no big financial institutions paid attention,” Kwock said. “People did not have a clear idea of fintech as it was still in an exploratory stage.”
In the years since, fintech in Hong Kong has gone through a sea...

items.title: DeepSeek releases first open AI model with gold-level scores at maths olympiad
items.creator: Vincent Chow
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: DeepSeek releases first open AI model with gold-level scores at maths olympiad

images.alt: DeepSeek’s Math-V2 model showed strong theorem-proving capabilities to achieve gold-level scores at the 2025 International Mathematical Olympiad. Photo: Shutterstock
images.title: DeepSeek’s Math-V2 model showed strong theorem-proving capabilities to achieve gold-level scores at the 2025 International Mathematical Olympiad. Photo: Shutterstock

items.content:
Chinese artificial intelligence company DeepSeek has released the world’s first open AI model to test and score a gold medal-level performance at the annual International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO), the Hangzhou-based start-up said on Thursday.
DeepSeek has made widely available its Math-V2 model, which was open-sourced on developer platforms Hugging Face and GitHub, under a permissive licence that allows users to repurpose the model.
Held annually since 1959, the IMO is widely regarded as the...

items.title: Tensions flare as Wingtech slams chipmaker Nexperia’s head office over deception
items.creator: Zhou Xin
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Tensions flare as Wingtech slams chipmaker Nexperia’s head office over deception

images.alt: Bikes are seen parked next to Nexperia China’s factory in Dongguan, southern Guangdong province, on November 7, 2025. Photo: Reuters
images.title: Bikes are seen parked next to Nexperia China’s factory in Dongguan, southern Guangdong province, on November 7, 2025. Photo: Reuters

items.content:
A fierce war of words has erupted between Dutch chipmaker Nexperia and its Chinese owner, Wingtech Technology, after China and the European Union signalled that their dispute should be resolved at the corporate level.
Wingtech accused Nexperia’s head office of being insincere after the Dutch head office publicly released a letter that said the chipmaker’s Chinese unit had been unresponsive to requests for talks.
The heightened tensions underscore the complexity in resolving the two sides’...

items.title: Meituan swings into loss in ‘milk tea’ subsidy war with instant commerce rivals
items.creator: Wency Chen,Ann Cao
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Meituan swings into loss in ‘milk tea’ subsidy war with instant commerce rivals
items.content:
China’s food-delivery giant Meituan swung to a deep quarterly loss, as a costly battle with Alibaba Group Holding’s instant commerce business eroded margins and kept revenue growth modest.
The Beijing-based company on Friday reported revenue of 95.5 billion yuan (US$13.3 billion) for the three months to September, up 2 per cent year on year, missing analysts' estimates of 97.5 billion yuan.
However, it booked an operating loss of 19.8 billion yuan, compared with a 13.7 billion yuan operating...

items.title: Alibaba Cloud team wins top AI award for breakthrough in model efficiency
items.creator: Vincent Chow
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Alibaba Cloud team wins top AI award for breakthrough in model efficiency

images.alt: The Qwen logo is displayed on a phone screen behind an AI image with integrated circuits. Photo: Shutterstock Images
images.title: The Qwen logo is displayed on a phone screen behind an AI image with integrated circuits. Photo: Shutterstock Images

items.content:
A research team led by Alibaba Cloud was the only group from China to receive a top award at this year’s NeurIPS, or the Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems, billed as the artificial intelligence industry’s most prestigious annual event.
The research could lead to drastic improvements in the efficiency of large language models (LLMs), significantly reducing both training and inference costs for Alibaba Group Holding’s next generation of Qwen models without sacrificing...

items.title: China’s proposed new regulations on power banks worry producers and consumers
items.creator: Danielle Popov
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s proposed new regulations on power banks worry producers and consumers

images.alt: As the world’s largest producer of power banks, China’s tighter rules could force a shake-up in the industry itself. Photo: Shutterstock Images
images.title: As the world’s largest producer of power banks, China’s tighter rules could force a shake-up in the industry itself. Photo: Shutterstock Images

items.content:
Chinese regulations that propose tighter technical specs for portable power banks are stirring unease among producers and consumers, as they could mean passengers are no longer allowed to bring such products on board flights.
According to a draft document from the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT), which is soliciting feedback until December 11, all Chinese portable power banks would be required to disclose their battery type, production date and offer a recommendation for...

items.title: From Singapore to Malaysia, tech firms double down on AI despite bubble fears

items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: From Singapore to Malaysia, tech firms double down on AI despite bubble fears

images.alt: Dylan Tan, founder of replyr.ai, thinks a reset may be good for the industry. Photo: Dylan Tan
images.title: Dylan Tan, founder of replyr.ai, thinks a reset may be good for the industry. Photo: Dylan Tan

items.content:
As fears over the artificial intelligence bubble bursting linger in global markets, one Southeast Asian tech founder thinks it could be a much-needed reset to a crowded space.
Dylan Tan, founder of replyr.ai, a Singapore-based start-up that creates AI WhatsApp sales agents for its clients, said there was a disconnect between the investor hype driving up tech stocks and an understanding of how AI would transform the future of businesses. Replyr.ai was founded with venture capitalist funds in...

items.translated_title: DeepSeek, Alibaba researchers endorse China’s AI regulatory framework

images.alt: The Alibaba logo is seen at its office in Beijing, Aug. 10, 2021. Photo: AP
images.title: The Alibaba logo is seen at its office in Beijing, Aug. 10, 2021. Photo: AP

items.content:
Researchers from artificial intelligence start-up DeepSeek and tech giant Alibaba Group Holding have endorsed China’s emerging AI regulatory framework while calling for clearer feedback in a paper published in the US journal Science.
The paper, published last month under the title “China’s emerging regulation towards an open future for AI”, said the country had so far facilitated an “innovation- and openness-friendly institutional environment for AI developers” but that it could be further...

items.title: Stampede for Moore Threads’ IPO as China flexes its GPU ambitions
items.creator: Wency Chen
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Stampede for Moore Threads’ IPO as China flexes its GPU ambitions
items.content:
Chinese onshore investor frenzy for artificial intelligence chips has intensified, with the initial public offering (IPO) of Beijing-based graphics processing unit (GPU) maker Moore Threads drawing more than 4,000 times subscription from retail investors this week.
The red-hot demand for Moore Threads highlights China’s determination to build home-grown alternatives to Nvidia’s chips, and is expected to accelerate listing plans for other domestic GPU developers, from MetaX to Biren...

items.title: Alibaba launches US$537 Quark AI glasses to challenge devices from Meta, Xiaomi
items.creator: Ann Cao
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Alibaba launches US$537 Quark AI glasses to challenge devices from Meta, Xiaomi
items.content:
Alibaba Group Holding on Thursday launched its first artificial intelligence glasses in China, as the tech giant seeks to carve out a solid niche in the growing smart wearables market.
The Quark AI Glasses, named after the company’s Quark AI assistant, include three versions each of the series’ flagship S1 model and the lightweight G1 model. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.
“AI glasses are the intelligent devices that truly usher in a revolution in human-computer interaction in the AI...

items.title: UBS remains bullish on Chinese tech but warns of big market swings in 2026
items.creator: Themis Qi,Julie Zhang
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: UBS remains bullish on Chinese tech but warns of big market swings in 2026

images.alt: Hu Yifan (left) and Eva Lee of UBS, which says today’s AI boom differs from the dot-com era. Photo: Themis Qi
images.title: Hu Yifan (left) and Eva Lee of UBS, which says today’s AI boom differs from the dot-com era. Photo: Themis Qi

items.content:
UBS has warned of greater market volatility next year, citing risks ranging from weaker-than-expected artificial intelligence revenue to geopolitical tensions, but the Swiss investment bank remains bullish about Chinese technology shares and gold.
UBS identified five major market risks for next year: economic weakness, a resurgence of inflation, government debts, renewed US-China conflicts, and disappointing returns from AI after three years of heavy investment.
“One point that we can be very...

items.title: Xiaomi hires engineer from Tesla’s Optimus team to lead robotic hand development

items.translated_title: Xiaomi hires engineer from Tesla’s Optimus team to lead robotic hand development

images.alt: Zach Lu Zeyu previously worked as a senior engineer on Tesla’s Optimus humanoid robot. Photo: Handout
images.title: Zach Lu Zeyu previously worked as a senior engineer on Tesla’s Optimus humanoid robot. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Xiaomi has hired a former engineer from Tesla’s Optimus team, Zach Lu Zeyu, to join the Chinese tech giant’s robotics initiatives, as the talent grab in the industry intensifies.
Lu, previously a senior robotics engineer focused on the Optimus humanoid robot, joined Xiaomi last month to lead the Beijing-based firm’s dexterous hand research and development operations, according to his LinkedIn page.
During his two years at Tesla, Lu worked on the design for dexterous grasping and manipulation, as...

items.title: Baidu cuts jobs, restructures AI teams after loss-making quarter
items.creator: Ben Jiang
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Baidu cuts jobs, restructures AI teams after loss-making quarter
items.content:
Chinese tech giant Baidu is cutting an undisclosed number of jobs across major divisions and restructuring artificial intelligence teams, as the company moves to streamline operations following a loss-making quarter, according to multiple sources.
Baidu has axed staff in Beijing, Shanghai and Guangzhou, affecting multiple major business units from its mobile ecosystem group, which includes its bread-and-butter search business, to intelligent cloud and technology platform groups, according to...

items.title: Jack Ma Foundation pledges US$4 million for Hong Kong fire victims

items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Jack Ma Foundation pledges US$4 million for Hong Kong fire victims

images.alt: The Jack Ma Foundation has pledged to donate about US$4 million to help fire victims. Photo: Handout
images.title: The Jack Ma Foundation has pledged to donate about US$4 million to help fire victims. Photo: Handout

items.content:
The Jack Ma Foundation said on Thursday it would donate HK$30 million (US$3.9 million) to support families, firefighters and rescuers affected by a deadly fire at a housing estate in Hong Kong’s Tai Po district.
In a statement, the foundation – established by the founder of Alibaba Group Holding and Ant Group – expressed solidarity with all those affected by the tragedy. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.
The donation follows a further commitment of HK$20 million from Alibaba and HK$10...

items.title: AI transforms global mining, power generation and chemicals industries
items.creator: Morning Studio editors
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: AI transforms global mining, power generation and chemicals industries

images.alt: Linda Han, vice-president of Huawei Technologies and CEO of the company’s oil, gas and mining business unit, says AI is playing a central part in the transformation of the natural resources sector.
images.title: Linda Han, vice-president of Huawei Technologies and CEO of the company’s oil, gas and mining business unit, says AI is playing a central part in the transformation of the natural resources sector.

images.alt: Smart mining systems that use AI to analyse huge geological data, for example from wireless photogrammetry and dynamic data transmission from sensors on vehicles, can help reduce exploration budgets and boost operational efficiency. Photo: Adobe Stock
images.title: Smart mining systems that use AI to analyse huge geological data, for example from wireless photogrammetry and dynamic data transmission from sensors on vehicles, can help reduce exploration budgets and boost operational efficiency. Photo: Adobe Stock

images.alt: The use of Huawei’s AI model to analyse and interpret geophysical data can help mining companies cut the time they spend on oil exploration and extraction. Photo: Shutterstock
images.title: The use of Huawei’s AI model to analyse and interpret geophysical data can help mining companies cut the time they spend on oil exploration and extraction. Photo: Shutterstock

images.alt: Chinese fertiliser producer Yuntianhua uses Huawei’s AI-powered Pangu model to predict gasifier operating parameters such as the temperature and slag viscosity in the processes involved in making ammonia.
images.title: Chinese fertiliser producer Yuntianhua uses Huawei’s AI-powered Pangu model to predict gasifier operating parameters such as the temperature and slag viscosity in the processes involved in making ammonia.

items.content:
The rapid and enthusiastic adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) is already having a seismic effect on industries around the world, enabling new efficiencies and bringing fundamental change to the way organisations plan and operate.
Importantly, but perhaps not yet widely recognised, the impact of this tech revolution is also being seen in many areas of the natural resources sector – including mining, oil and gas, chemicals and building materials – where the latest advances are reshaping core...

items.title: Hong Kong’s HKChat app raises AI expectations as 90,000 join app in debut week (原标题: Hong Kong’s HKChat raises AI expectations as 90,000 users join app in debut week)
items.creator: Xinmei Shen
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Hong Kong’s HKChat app raises AI expectations as 90,000 join app in debut week
items.content:
Hong Kong’s first locally developed artificial intelligence chatbot, HKChat, has raised expectations that it could compete with more popular and established AI apps, as it racked up around 90,000 users in the city within a week of its low-key release.
HKChat is focused on providing information on local services, including real-time bus arrivals, as well as the city’s weather, laws and regulations. It was the top-ranked free app on Apple’s Hong Kong App Store on Sunday, according to data from app...

items.title: AI scaling hasn’t reached a dead end yet, Chinese Google scientist says
items.creator: Vincent Chow
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: AI scaling hasn’t reached a dead end yet, Chinese Google scientist says

images.alt: A Google DeepMind scientist says scaling is still expected to yield better AI models in the near future. Photo: Dreamstime/TNS
images.title: A Google DeepMind scientist says scaling is still expected to yield better AI models in the near future. Photo: Dreamstime/TNS

items.content:
There remains considerable potential to enhance artificial intelligence models by scaling up computing power and data, according to Yao Shunyu, a senior staff research scientist at Google DeepMind and former researcher at US AI start-up Anthropic.
Amid heated discussions in the AI community about the future of scaling – the process of increasing computational resources and training data to develop better AI models – Yao said the method was still expected to yield results for at least a year...

items.title: Alibaba to lead AI capital spending among Chinese firms amid strong demand
items.creator: Ann Cao,Bien Perez
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Alibaba to lead AI capital spending among Chinese firms amid strong demand
items.content:
E-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding expects to stay ahead of its Chinese Big Tech peers in artificial intelligence-related capital expenditure, as the firm’s AI and cloud computing unit posted its fourth consecutive quarter of double-digit revenue growth.
Alibaba Cloud on Tuesday reported a 34 per cent year-on-year revenue growth to 39.8 billion yuan (US$5.6 billion) in the three months ended September 30, as the Hangzhou-based parent’s overall revenue in its financial second quarter reached...

items.title: Chinese AI start-up takes on Google in tensor processing unit race
items.creator: Wency Chen
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Chinese AI start-up takes on Google in tensor processing unit race

images.alt: Google’s tensor processing unit. Photo: Handout
images.title: Google’s tensor processing unit. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Chinese AI chip start-up Zhonghao Xinying has emerged as a home-grown alternative to Nvidia with a new tensor processing unit (TPU), just as Google shakes up Nvidia’s lock on the market by selling its in-house tensor chips directly to major tech firms.
The Hangzhou-based firm, also known as CL Tech, said its self-developed general-purpose tensor processing unit (GPTPU) went into mass production as early as 2023. Its flagship chip, dubbed Chana, delivers up to “1.5 times the compute performance”...

items.title: Hiking in China made easy with rental exoskeletons
items.creator: Thomas Yau
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Hiking in China made easy with rental exoskeletons
items.content:
In China’s tech hub Hangzhou, visitors to a country park can rent an exoskeleton to aid their climb for as little as 1 yuan (14 US cents).
The exoskeleton is said to make the hiking process almost “effortless”, according to Chinese social media users.
